December 2004

Slavic languages Professors Boris Gasparov and Alan Timberlake and Finnish language Lecturer Aili Flint have written a proposal to reestablish an official linguistics concentration.

Next year, eight seniors will graduate with an independent major in linguistics.

The professors started their campaign a few years ago by creating the Introduction to Linguistics course to pique interest. They gathered that students were intrigued not just in the course, but in the field of linguistics

Thirty-six students are enrolled in the course this semester.

. Thirty-six students are enrolled in the course this semester.

 

Currently, linguistics concentrations require student initiative; students must be willing to create an independent course of study and have it approved as a major by Academic Affairs.

. Thirty-six students are enrolled in the course this semester.

March 2009

This spring, two Columbia College students graduate with a major in linguistics.

 

They are the first since the '80s.

 

 

April 2012

John McWhorter’s Introduction to Linguistics course last semester had 146 students enrolled, more than double the 70 students who took the course in 2009.

Next year, eight seniors will graduate with an independent major in linguistics...

 

but will the department ever be unsuspended?

October 2019

For the first time in 36 years, Columbia will be offering a major in linguistics starting spring 2020 following a notice of approval by the New York State Department of Education sent late Tuesday night.
